revised_title: Corrigenda and Thymus Gland Research in Animals
tldr: This article discusses corrections in a previous publication and summarizes research on the thymus gland in animals. It highlights the findings that castration causes a persistent growth and a retarded atrophy of the gland in rabbits and cattle. The reciprocal action of the thymus on the testis is also investigated in guinea pigs, showing that thymectomy leads to a more rapid growth of the testes in young animals.
